group_1.narration: We had dinner with the folks from Kirimine Town, @and all that was left to do was bathe and tuck in… @When two girls came running into the villa.

group_1.textLeft: Mama was yelling so much at Papa…@And he just took it in silence.
I cannot stand to see them act like that anymore.

group_1.textRight: My father is all politics. @He doesn’t even look at me…
I thought it would be good to act out for once.

group_1.textLeft: I heard from word-of-mouth that this was @a women’s shelter…
I met her on the way here, and we decided @to walk together.
…I see. Where did you girls come from?
I don’t think you can stay here today… @All the rooms are full.

group_1.textRight: I arrived from Takarazaki City…
I’m from Futatsugi City…

group_1.textLeft: I see… Takarazaki City is one thing, @but Futatsugi City is so far away…
I can’t send you home this late at night…
Well then…I’d like your parent’s contact @information so I can check in with them.

group_1.textRight: …Huh? You’re going to call them?

group_1.textLeft: You’re both minors, so it’s only natural if you’re @going to stay the night, don’t you think?

group_1.textRight: I hadn’t really thought of that…
I was…just trying to rebel a bit…

group_1.textLeft: But as I said before, we don’t have @any rooms available.
Are you okay sleeping in the living room?

group_1.textRight: Yeah, that’s fine by me…
I’m so tired I think I could sleep anywhere.
Oh, in that case, may I sleep in the living @room as well?
I grew up in the village so I lack many experiences. @I need to broaden my horizons.
At least that’s what my mother always says.

group_1.textLeft: Well, I don’t see any problem with that…
Oh, then I want to, too!

group_1.textRight: *Giggle* Sounds like this will be a fun night.

group_1.narration: It was decided that we would sleep in the living room.@I invited Sana, but she gets nervous around strangers,@so she decided to sleep in her own room with Ui.
We introduced ourselves in the living room, @and it turns out that Nayuta @is actually Touka’s cousin.
Although they don’t seem to get along…
I also learned that Yuna lives in Futatsugi City, @where her father is the mayor.

group_1.textLeft: So you both ran away from home?

group_1.textRight: Yes, that’s right.

group_1.textLeft: Hm… I can’t really imagine wanting to run away @from home.

group_1.narration: ―Nayuta―@Of course I wanted to run away from home!@Mama gets mad all the time and takes it out on Papa.
―Nayuta―@And he just sits back and goes along with it!@I can’t help but be so angry at both of them!
―Nayuta―@I tried to tell them how I felt, but they wouldn’t listen to me.@So I got choked up and ran off.
―Yuna―@I grew up as the mayor’s daughter, with all the stifling@restrictions and expectations that come with the role.
―Yuna―@So I acted out and went to a low ranking school, @although it was just childish rebellion.
―Yuna―@But he just pushed me to the side and tried to cover it up,@like I was some stain on his reputation.
―Yuna―@So I decided to leave on my own.
―Nayuta―@That’s right. Running away from home is@a way children like us can express ourselves.
―Shizuka―@I understand how difficult it can be@to get through to your parents.
―Shizuka―@I often clash with my mother and get upset,@but sometimes arguing helps us reach a better understanding.
―Shizuka―@I think you two should face things with your parents@head on, instead of running away from home.
―Iroha―@But I’m sure you’re here because @it’s easier said than done…

group_1.textLeft: I see… You’re right… @Sorry, that was a bit insensitive.

group_1.textRight: …But come to think of it, I don’t think @my father and I have ever argued.
Similarly, after I was told there was no point @in discussing these matters,
I simply gave up on our relationship.
I am no different from my papa, @who never speaks up for himself…

group_1.textLeft: …[wait:0.5][chara:100101:lipSynch_1]Well, how would you like your parents to be?

group_1.textRight: I just…want my father to see me for who I am.

group_1.narration: "...I was pushed to become the Student Council @President by everyone around me, @with the goal of reforming the school."
"However I realized that issues in the school @weren’t restricted to the student body, @but also the school’s administration."
"In order to fix that, I’d need to follow @my father’s path to politics. @So instead, I decided to become the Student @Council President in my second year."
"I thought if I did something tangible @with my own hands and beliefs, @then my father would recognize my worth @and more than just a political tool…"
"But that wasn’t what my father had envisioned... @I wanted to be independent; @to confront the traditions and adults @that were causing systemic problems."

"I earned my own tuition money, @reformed the school, proved my independence… @But the harder I tried, the further I drifted @from my father’s ideal, and he eventually @stopped wanting to be around me."

group_1.textRight: I want my father to see me.
Not as "the mayor’s daughter"...@But as HIS daughter.

group_1.textLeft: So that’s how it is…

group_1.textRight: I just want Mama to be nicer to Papa.
And I want Papa to be able to talk back @to Mama sometimes.

group_1.narration: "I am not looking for us to always @get along perfectly without ever fighting... @I don’t mind if we fight sometimes, @as long as we love each other as a family."
"Since I don’t understand my parents, @I wonder why they’re still together, @or why they decided to marry, @or why they gave birth to me…@And I feel so sad and lost."

group_1.textLeft: …I see. So you’re full of lots of different @emotions…
…Yep, in times like this, there’s only @one thing to do!
You have to shout all of your thoughts at once!
Yes! We’ll listen to all of them!

group_1.narration: After that, the conversation about Nayuta’s @and Yuna’s parents went on and on…

group_1.textLeft: …It seems like you had a lot of pent up anger.
I thought you’d feel refreshed afterwards, @but you seem pretty down…
You don’t really hate your mother, do you?
Since it’s all out in the open, isn’t it time @to go back and make things right?

group_1.textRight: …I can’t say I like them…@But I would be sad to never see them again.
I don’t like the Mama who scolds Papa @or the Mama who’s overly strict with me…
But I suppose her strictness is why I’m doing @well in school.
So one could say I am being raised well.
While there are some things I don't like, @we're a family… It’s hard to find the words…
While my papa is somewhat pathetic, @I do love him a lot…
I’m…getting lonely… @*Sob* I miss them…

group_1.narration: *Ding-Dong*

group_1.textLeft: I’m sorry to bother you so late at night… @But I heard that my daughter Nayuta is here?
…Mama…Papa…

group_1.textRight: Oh Nayuta, I’m so sorry.
…This whole mess is because you’ve spoiled @her rotten…
Ha ha… Sorry…

group_1.textLeft: See, this is the WHOLE problem!

group_1.narration: "Mama must be nicer to Papa, @and Papa needs to stand up for himself! @We are a family, so it’s okay to argue sometimes! @I hate how you both act like this!"

"I feel like I am going to suffocate around you… @I don’t like thinking that way…@because you are my parents, and @I want to miss you when you’re not around… @But what even are we? Can you call this a family?"

group_1.textLeft: After all…aren’t we a family because @you both love each other?
Isn’t that…the reason I was born?
…If you both keep acting like this…@I can’t understand why I’m here.

group_1.textCenter: Oh…Oh, Nayuta, I’m so sorry for making you @feel this way…

group_1.textRight: …You’re right. I’m sorry, Nayuta. @This time I’m the one in the wrong…

group_1.textLeft: I don’t care…as long as we can patch things up.

group_1.textRight: …It’s true, I’ve been too hard on you, @and I apologize for that.

group_1.textCenter: No, it’s my fault too…@I should have spoken up more.
Maybe this all happened because we’ve avoided @really talking with each other.

group_1.textLeft: Please tell me, are you both still in love @with each other?

group_1.textRight: …[wait:0.8][chara:800600:lipSynch_1][chara:800600:cheek_1][chara:800600:face_mtn_ex_030.exp.json]Even while we clash, we still mesh together…

group_1.textCenter: …I suppose that’s always been our relationship.
I think the answer is clear, considering we both @came to pick you up, Nayuta.

group_1.textLeft: Nayuta and her folks kept arguing as they @went home.

group_1.textRight: Well, isn’t that how it is when you’re a family?

group_1.textLeft: I guess there are many forms of happiness…

group_1.textRight: Well, after seeing all that…
I’m starting to think I should be more honest @with my father.
I thought that arguing would make me @seem childish.
But maybe running away is even more childish.
No matter what I do, my father doesn’t @acknowledge my efforts.
If I want him to truly see me, I guess I’ll have @to MAKE him look at me.

group_1.textLeft: I think it’s important to truly talk to him.

group_1.textRight: …It’s thanks to you guys that I’ve been able @to see things clearly.

group_1.textLeft: All I did was listen to your thoughts…

group_1.textRight: I don’t think anyone’s given me @that opportunity before.
Tomorrow morning, I’ll head home and confront @my father head-on.
I’m sure we’re going to get into a huge fight.

group_1.textLeft: Do your best and don’t hurt each other! @I wish you the best of luck!

group_1.textRight: It’s not like we’re gonna get into a fistfight…

group_1.narration: Nayuta’s true happiness… @Yuna’s true happiness…
Just like in the book, @joy comes in many forms… @Everyone has their own special happiness.
I haven’t found my "true happiness" yet, @but seeing everyone so happy… @I can’t help but smile.
